thread.title: My Shop: How YouTube saved one shopkeeper but nearly broke her
thread.title_full: My Shop: How YouTube saved one shopkeeper but nearly broke her

title: My Shop: How YouTube saved one shopkeeper but nearly broke her
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device My Shop: How YouTube saved one shopkeeper but nearly broke her 12 February 2017 Last updated at 00:48 GMT 
When Lucy Myatt's dream comic shop hit hard times, she turned to video platform YouTube and found more customers by vlogging. But unexpected attention took a heavy personal toll on her. 
She runs Level Up, a "geek's paradise" selling comics and retro computer games, in Liverpool's Quiggins mall for independent shops. 
Video journalist Dougal Shaw went to meet her there. 
This video is part of a series from the BBC Business Unit called My Shop . The series focuses on distinctive, independent shops and is filmed on a smartphone. To suggest a shop . For the latest updates about the series follow video journalist Dougal Shaw on Twitter or Facebook . Related Topics
